email.title: Weekly Digest

image.title: Or just no biscuit. Hmm. So many options.

email.text:
Welcome back to another edition of the DoCSoc digest!
IC Hack 18 is over! Thank you so much to all our sponsors and to everyone who participated and volunteered - it has been an incredible weekend! If you haven't already (and even if you have), watch the event montage [here on YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hngr7ts45Dc).
While everyone is recovering, we're glad to finally announce a couple of events, and we're also looking for speakers for our upcoming UROP 101 and Internship 101 events. See below :).
Lastly, I've been delibrating the place and relevancy of the weekly biscuit. Over the weeks that I've written the digest, coming up with a biscuit every week has become quite a burden. Therefore I propose several options pertaining to the future of the biscuit:
- Weekly biscuit, chosen by YOU. - No biscuit. Just nothing. - Some other kind of confectionery. - Something else?
[Please submit your votes here so that we may democratically decide the future of the biscuit.](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfuJkKLu6KQPJMJpHEd8wJyRFqWvRf9IH8Q3pZYZ4quGvmoIQ/viewform)
email.heading: DoCSoc hosts Google Hash Code
IC HealthHack 2018
Call for UROP 101 Speakers
email.text:
If you did a UROP in the past and would like to share your experience in a short talk aimed at first and second year students, please email us at docsoc@imperial.ac.uk.
This talk will take place on Friday, February 9th between 13.00 and 14.00 in Huxley 145. The lightning talks start at 13.20, and you can leave as soon as you've finished the talk if you wish.
email.heading: Call for Internship 101 Speakers
email.text:
Have you worked for a company in the past who are currently still accepting applications? Share your experience with your fellow coursemates at Internship 101!
We're looking for speakers to speak at our Internship 101 event, happening soon! Like in past years, it's a panel-style event where you share your experience in a very short 5-10 minute talk. You don't need to have great public speaking skills, but be ready to answer questions about the company.
If this is something that you would like to do, please email us at docsoc@imperial.ac.uk.
email.heading: Diversity@Imperial Lunchtime Lecture

event.location: RSM 131 - Sutton Lecture Theatre, South Kensington Campus
event.text:
This week Thursday (1st Feb), as part of the College's 'Diversity@Imperial' campaign, the Equality, Diversity and Inclusion Centre will be hosting a lunchtime lecture on 'A Sense of Belonging in Engineering', given by Dr Nike Folayan.
Dr Folayan is the Chairperson of the Association for Black and Minority Engineers (AFBE-UK), a national organisation to support and promote BAME engineers and engineering students through their careers in their respective industries. She will be discussing what diversity and the drive towards a more inclusive STEM workforce really mean, with a particular focus on the importance of diversity and inclusion in engineering.

email.sign:
That's all for now!
Until next time,
